api/CGRust.Wrapper.CGRustArray-1.html.summary: Struct CGRustArray<T> Namespace CGRust.Wrapper Assembly CGRust.Wrapper.dll Helper class for handling arrays allocated in Rust. getting-started.html.title: Getting Started | CGRust for Unity
getting-started.html.summary: Getting Started Installation First, make sure you have Unity 6 or newer installed. Now, download CGRust and copy the CGRust folder from the assets folder into your own project. If there are no compilation errors, the library is installed. For checking if it works correctly, head to the Samples folder and try starting one of the scenes. Creating a Simple Mesh TODO (How to create a simple mesh and show it in the scene using CGRust)

index.html.title: Home | CGRust for Unity
index.html.summary: Introduction *CGRust is a library written in Rust containing computational geometry algorithms used in Games, Simulations, CADs, etc. The rust implementation is open-source and can be found here. The Wrapper, which this documentation is about, exposes the functionality of that libary to Unity, to enable the use of fast and safe computational geometry algorithms in C#.
